author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content:
Do you think EIP *reviewing* should/could be a "formal" duty with a membership list (similar to the EIP editor membership list with github permissions)?

(vs today's situation of twitter + blogs + ethresearch + ethmagicians + devcon(nect) + client implementations + robust-incentives-group + academic papers)

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't think we would benefit significantly from that.  There may be value in some ecosystem funding being put toward paying highly qualified individuals review EIPs, but I don't think we should do anything that puts up any kind of barrier to entry into reviewing content.

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content:
very fair

I was imagining it not as a barrier but as a floor // fallback

such that there'd also be review by at least someone in the review-set, regardless of any community discussion

author: sky.cactus
content: I think we can achieve that just through ecosystem funding of highly qualified reviewers.

author: sky.cactus
content: These reviewers wouldn't have any special powers or influence, they would just be there to ensure a keen eye was reviewing everything.
